headline: Retail earnings: Consumers are spending on needs, not wants
summary: Retailers are in focus following Target's (TGT), Home Depot's (HD), and TJ Maxx parent company TJX's (TJX) earnings results, while investors await Walmart's (WMT) earnings results out Thursday morning. Placer.ai head of analytical research R.J. Hottovy shares his takeaways from retail earnings so far and what they signal about the health of the consumer. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ekes Out Gain; Nasdaq Comes Off Lows While Palantir Retakes Key Level After 15% Plunge
summary: Other major indexes remained in the red in a session where investors saw division amongst monetary policymakers in the minutes of the Federal Reserve's July meeting.  Several retail stocks moved on earnings, while Palantir Technologies managed to retake a key level on the stock market today after falling more than 15%.  Meanwhile, investors awaited a speech from Fed Chairman Jerome Powell.

headline: Watch Walmart’s Earnings for What’s Really Going On in Retail
summary: Target announced a CEO change, Lowe’s unveiled an $8.8 billion acquisition, and  Home Depot’s  report was crowded out by commentary on how the housing market is affecting home improvement.  Walmart’s  report, due Thursday morning, should give investors the quiet they need to focus on the big picture.  Analysts predict Walmart will post another strong quarter, cementing itself yet again as a beacon of steadfastness amid the turbulence rocking the broader retail ecosystem.

Analysts predict Walmart will post another strong quarter, cementing itself yet again as a beacon of steadfastness amid the turbulence rocking the broader retail ecosystem.

headline: Lowe's (LOW) Q2 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Marvin Ellison: Thank you, Kate, and good morning, everyone.  This morning, we announced the acquisition of Foundation Building Materials or FBM, a premier distributor of interior building products including drywall, metal framing, ceiling systems, insulation, commercial doors, and hardware, and other complementary products.  This acquisition represents a transformational move when it comes to advancing our total home strategy and enhancing long-term shareholder value.

raw.headline: Lowe's (LOW) Q2 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
raw.summary: Marvin Ellison: Thank you, Kate, and good morning, everyone.  This morning, we announced the acquisition of Foundation Building Materials or FBM, a premier distributor of interior building products including drywall, metal framing, ceiling systems, insulation, commercial doors, and hardware, and other complementary products.  This acquisition represents a transformational move when it comes to advancing our total home strategy and enhancing long-term shareholder value.

headline: Lowe's Raises Outlook, Expands Pro Reach With $8.8 Billion Acquisition
summary: Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE:LOW) reported second-quarter net earnings of $2.4 billion, or diluted Earnings Per Share (EPS) of $4.27, compared to $4.17 in the year-ago quarter. Adjusted diluted EPS rose 5.6% to $4.33 from $4.10, topping analyst estimates of $4.24. Quarterly sales reached $23.96 billion, compared with $23.59 billion a year earlier, and came in slightly above Wall Street’s estimate of $23.96 billion. Comparable sales increased 1.1%. Also Read: Home Depot Navigates Traffic Decline,

headline: Lowe's buying Foundation Building Materials for about $8.8B as it intensifies focus on pro builders
summary: Lowe's is buying Foundation Building Materials, a distributor of drywall, insulation and other products, for approximately $8.8 billion as the home improvement retailer intensifies its focus on professional builders.  FBM also provides metal framing, ceiling systems, commercial doors and hardware and other products that serve large residential and commercial professionals in both new construction and repair and remodel applications.  The acquisition is part of Lowe's move to provide more options for professional builders.

raw.headline: Lowe's buying Foundation Building Materials for about $8.8B as it intensifies focus on pro builders
raw.summary: Lowe's is buying Foundation Building Materials, a distributor of drywall, insulation and other products, for approximately $8.8 billion as the home improvement retailer intensifies its focus on professional builders.  FBM also provides metal framing, ceiling systems, commercial doors and hardware and other products that serve large residential and commercial professionals in both new construction and repair and remodel applications.  The acquisition is part of Lowe's move to provide more options for professional builders.
